attributes.action: That the government suspends Foreign Aid for 3 years to fund social care
attributes.background: Approx £12bn was spent in foreign aid in 2015. The biggest recipient Pakistan has nuclear weapons! This cash could be used to fund a social care program that cares for the elderly, disabled and those with mental health issues. Bed blocking costs the NHS approx £900m a year.
attributes.additional_details: Patients cannot be discharged because they are unable to cope at home alone without care.This puts huge pressure on the NHS and puts seriously ill patients at risk. Budgets in elderley, disabled and mental health care are being continually cut thereby forcing people back into the NHS system. The problem will continue to get worse as the population lives longer and budgets are squeezed even harder. This cash could be used to create a sustainable social care plan to address these issues

attributes.action: Ban Chewing Gum from being sold in the UK. Make towns cleaner and healthier.
attributes.background: No matter where you go in the UK, most towns and cities will have areas that have a high level of chewing gum spread across pavements and walkways. Not only is unsightly, embarrassing and spreads germs. It costs councils lots of money to sort out. Money that could be used elsewhere i.e. NHS etc.

attributes.action: Create Protocol for Government Intervention in Strikes (e.g. Southern stalemate)
attributes.background: We would like to petition the government to seriously contemplate introducing a system in which labour disputes involving services essential to our economy, such as the Southern rail strike, can be handled in the case of long-running disruption and lack of agreement between the principle parties.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the that government consider methods implemented by other nations, for example Canada, where the options include binding arbitration [For more information: http://www.cbc.ca/1.1000525]

Though we cannot quantify what the Southern rail strike has cost the economy, it certainly has had an effect; ramifications on citizens' lives must also be appreciated. In situations such as these, it would be beneficial to have a governmental framework in place. 

With thanks for your consideration.

attributes.action: Stop paying subsidies for renewables because they are adding CO2 not reducing it
attributes.background: The thermal efficiency of Closed Cycle Gas Turbines (CCGTs) when ramping up and down in response to wind generation drops for up to 4 hours and each end of the ramping process. This increases the amount of gas that is burned so that 35kg of CO2 is emitted for every MWh generated by wind generation.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/9559656/Germanys-wind-power-chaos-should-be-a-warning-to-the-UK.html

http://www.heraldscotland.com/opinion/letters/15087524.Renewables_has_so_far_been_failed_experiment/

attributes.action: Repeal and replace the NFAOP act 1861 with something new and up to date
attributes.background: The best ways in which parliament could update this act is by putting the offences of ABH and GBH in the same act as battery and assault so the law is more concise. In addition to this they could actually define what GBH and ABH is rather than leaving it to the courts to define.
attributes.additional_details: This act is used daily. It is over 150 years old, and lacks key definitions. It is an extremely important act of Parliament, even being considered the workhorse of the legal system by some. The courts themselves have had to define key terms including what constitutes as ABH (Chan Fook) and what constitutes as Wounding (Eisenhower). It shouldn't be left to the courts to decide what Parliament meant when writing the acts as Parliament should have done a good enough job in defining these terms.

attributes.action: Abolish naturalisation fees for any EU migrant who exercises EU treaty rights
attributes.background: Estimated 2.9 million people from EU live in the UK at the moment and contribute to the culture and the economy of UK. It's estimated that "the net fiscal contribution of migrants from the ten central and eastern European countries that joined the EU in 2004 or 2007 was almost £5 billion".
attributes.additional_details: We do contribute to the culture and enrich tradition in this multicultural country. In full respect to the law which allows EU members to stay in the UK, we'd like to ask for the fees to be abolished as a recognition for the contributions we made to the society.

attributes.action: Make employers pay a minimum of 6 Month full maternity pay to employees.
attributes.background: It should be compulsory for companies to pay an employee that has been with a company for at least a year their full monthly wage. Too many companies are not offering any benefits to new mothers putting the burden on the government system to pay this amount.
attributes.additional_details: It is impossible for a woman to live on an average of £112 weekly from the government, with rent or mortgage, bills, food shopping and a new baby to take care off its questionable as to how she would survive without going back to work almost immediately after giving birth or alternatively having to quit work to receive far better benefits from the government this would certainly put more pressure on the government  but If full pay for 6 was made compulsory it would save on government resources.

attributes.action: Dual train (mental health and physical health) paramedics and nurses
attributes.background: Any individual who is training to become a paramedic or nurse does not have to have any mental health training. With more and more people developing mental health issues, all medical professionals; especially frontline ones, should have mental health training alongside their medical training.
attributes.additional_details: The problem is evident all over the country; more people who are in a mental health crisis or who have a history of mental health issues are calling 999, paramedics are sent to these individuals but because they are not usually physically unwell they are either assessed and left, or taken to hospital, where A&E doctors evaluate their physical health and once that is given the OK they are sent home, with no intervention from mental health services and usually the cycle starts again...

attributes.action: Prevent the rise in tuition fees under the TEF for university students
attributes.background: The TEF is the teaching excellence framework, an idea which in itself is not necessarily negative and will attempt to bring universities to a similar standard however the rise in fees associated with the cash incentives, some universities would see a steady increase in already climbing tuition fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.savethestudent.org/news/whats-the-deal-with-the-tef.html

attributes.action: Reduce taxes for U30s that earn below £25,000
attributes.background: It is a constant struggle for those who are starting a career , whilst living somewhere where there are a number of career opportunities.  A tax break would help with rents and affordability of life, and reduce debt for those starting off their own life.

attributes.action: Help fix the broken NHS with proper funding from increased NI contributions
attributes.background:
The NHS has funding issues and needs help immediately.
1. I would agree to a small increase in my national insurance contributions to help fix the ailing service
2. NI contributions to be ring fenced for the NHS only
3. An independent governing body to run the NHS and to control these funds

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Fat Tax' on foods to help beat the obesity crisis.
attributes.background:
Too often in stores youll find unhealthy foods tend to be cheaper, or on offer more often than healthier options. High streets are lined with fast food stores, which deliver cheap & quick option for individuals.
Introducing a fat tax will make healthier options more viable for individuals.

attributes.action: For the PM to notify the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25 March 2017
attributes.background: The people of the UK voted on 23rd June 2017 to leave the EU. The bill to withdraw is currently passing through Parliament. Once passed, it would be fitting for the Prime Minister to notify, under Article 50(2) of the Treaty on EU, the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25th March 2017.

attributes.action: Subsidise public transport for all UK citizens
attributes.background: We have a chicken and egg situation with our bus and train services. The huge costs of using public transport discourage people from using trains and buses，preferring to use cars instead. But the investment to improve the public transport system cannot be justified if not enough people use it.
attributes.additional_details: Measured in cost per mile travelled， the UK train service is up to ten times greater than other developed countries. The public understand the environmental need to reduce dependence on cars but cannot afford to do so. Increasing taxes on car usage is laudable but the cash incentive to use public transport is missing at present. The UK citizens should be incentivised with hugely reduced ticket prices， on presentation of a passport or other UK ID card.

attributes.action: Litter Tax and 100%  of that Tax goes to Picking up that Litter
attributes.background: The tax would support volunteers who litter pick ie transport to litter picking events , refreshments and a Register so volunteers could have a record of their contribution to society which could be used in CV's for example.
attributes.additional_details:
Tax worked out as a percentage of litter, so if  crisps made up 8% of litter they would pay 8% of that tax, then they would pass additional costs onto their customers. Basically those who drop it will pay for it to be cleaned up the company would then look for ways to encourage their customers to dispose of empty packets properly. 
People could put areas forward that need a clean with photos then a simple voting system photos of winning area after and during clean to show the system is working.

attributes.action: Forbid creation of any rule that isn't gender neutral by government bodies
attributes.background:
The UK government and police have been creating discriminatory rules which only apply to a subset of the population. It is critical we always write rules to be fair and protect all.

forbid the creation of any government backed rules which are not gender, race, disability and sexuality neutral
attributes.additional_details:
The government just agreed on a new bill which only includes female victims of so called "honour killings" despite as many as 1 in 4 victims of honour killing victims being male.
here : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0MgKWxlCWb0&ab_channel=TheDeplorables

Nottingham shire also introduced hate crime rules which only when committed against a women.
here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ya3ssMJPRJo&ab_channel=BBCNews

attributes.action: Make compulsory all councils collect the same waste & recycling in the same bins
attributes.background: All areas across the UK collect different waste and recycling in different bins. It is confusing for all not knowing what waste and recycling to put in which bin.  If the same things can be recycled in the same bins it would reduce confusion, increase recycling rates and reduce contamination.

attributes.action: UK should allocate more of its aid and development money to endangered species
attributes.background:
A proviso should be added to the aid and development money that we provide to Africa, that some of the money must to go towards endangered species.
Hopefully if the UK put aside more funds for endangered species, the African governments will also make a change.

attributes.action: Build A Road Link From Great Britain To Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
I'd like to see a road link be built with either a bridge or tunnel from the mainland (Great Britain), to Northern Ireland.
Not only would this connect the whole of the UK, but I belive would benefit trade between the home nations.
All of a sudden, Northern Ireland would be much more accessible.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-23672538

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=/amp/www.scotsman.com/business/companies/could-a-bridge-or-tunnel-one-day-link-scotland-with-ireland-1-4130353/amp&ved=0ahUKEwiQpvja_fTRAhUrBcAKHUxXA0UQFggpMAE&usg=AFQjCNFu7YCXfYxhQLc5wcsOrzUFPaKjRA&sig2=_FE223uc_ZiJK6gyYXPuMA

http://www.railforums.co.uk/showthread.php?t=35376

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_Sea_fixed_crossing

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: Use 2% of the UK's budget to help aid refugees affected by the Syrian war.
attributes.background: Currently, the Syrian war is forcing millions of refugees to flee to Europe for aid. I believe that if we are to become a peaceful world and allow society to advance in a prosperous way, we need to stop allowing stereotypical racism and fear to kill millions of suffering people.
attributes.additional_details: They are not here to steal jobs they want to be back in Syria but it's too unsafe. We need to make the country understand that these are people! Not statistics or terrorists! Just imagine if we were in the same situation.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women won’t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Set a goal of landing a person on the Moon by 2050.
attributes.background: A lot of people feel that the United Kingdom no longer has a sense of unity or direction in the wake of the EU referendum. Setting this goal would bring it back, as well as boosting industry and encouraging skilled workers to remain in the UK. It would also help our position as part of ESA.
attributes.additional_details: Only a few countries in the world are capable of launching humans into space and sadly neither the UK nor any member states of the European Space Agency have this capability. By setting this goal we will send a clear message to the world that we are still looking to be at the for front of technical innovation and achievement. It will also raise public awareness of the UK's satellite industry and encourage more people to get involved in science and technology.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Postpone Brexit by a year until we find out how US will be under new president
attributes.background: The USA president has issued several executive orders some of which are in contravention of international norms. There could be repercussions internationally and until we know the long term outcome we should not trigger Brexit just now which would mean reliance on an unstable trading partner of USA.
attributes.additional_details: Trump has issued many executive orders already, one of which is in contravention of the Geneva Convention on refugees. In retaliation at the ban on nationals from seven Muslim countries, Iran and Iraq are already discussing banning US nationals. This could produce further instability in an the Middle East. It would be naive of the UK to exit the single market and rely on trade with a country that not only disregards international norms but could alienate our other trading partners. Wait a year.

attributes.action: Reinstate Functional Skills as an alternative for Level 3 EYE's
attributes.background: I am concerned that in 2014, the government altered the requirements for those taking Level 3 in EYE and now, all Level 3 EYE's must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths to count in the ratios - with equitable alternatives such as Functional Skills no longer considered as an option.
attributes.additional_details: Potential new recruits, who have all the skills, including good English and maths, to be excellent Early Years Educators, will be barred from the sector. Its only a matter of time before we do not have the practitioners to fill the much needed roles which will have catastrophic impact on the Early Years sector, and in turn on parents and children. 30 hours free Child care is on its way.

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.

attributes.action: This nation should prohibit extradition of people to the USA.
attributes.background: The USA has a president who advocates torture and the USA practices imprisonment without trial at Guantanamo Bay. Both these are abhorent to any civilised society.

attributes.action: Recall the UK ambassador to the USA in protest against the travel ban
attributes.background: On 27 January 2017, the U.S. President signed an executive order banning all entry of people from seven muslim-majority countries. This includes refugees, holders of visas and green cards, and current. U.S. residents. The UK should officially recall its ambassador to the US in protest.
attributes.additional_details: The executive order signed by U.S. President Donald Trump and its consequences have been widely covered in the press. Many people currently travelling but living in the USA are suddenly separated from their loved ones, including refugees. The order is officially motivated by "anti-terrorism" but does not make anybody safer anywhere, no national from any listed country has commited terrorism on US soil. The UK must send the clearest possible signal of disapproval by recalling the US ambassador.

attributes.action: Ban child contact for violent fathers
attributes.background:
Reforms need to be introduce into family court to end the presumption that a father must have contact with a child where there is evidence of domestic abuse that would put the child&mother at risk
There are cases where children have been killed by their violent father due to contact given by judges

attributes.action: The banning of plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles.
attributes.background: Plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles have a MASSIVE detrimental impact on the world environment. Charging for these items in supermarkets etc is not enough. If they are not there we cannot buy them. These plastics are entering our food chain. Ban them now and make the world a better place.

attributes.action: Enshrine into law 1% of GDP  to be spent in NHS funding
attributes.background: The NHS needs guaranteed spending to allow the provision of free treatment for all UK citizens to continue. In the light of the government enshrining 0.6% of GDP spending, into law, to fund Foreign Aid we call upon the government to enshrine spending of 1% of GDP, into law, to fund the NHS.

attributes.action: Urge BT to convert old phone boxes for the homeless to store belongings safely
attributes.background: The majority of people now have mobile phones and many parts of London still have abandoned public phone boxes. In the west end homeless people store bedding in them - if these were converted into lockers they could store belongings and bedding securely.
attributes.additional_details: Some phone booths are already used this way, this would create added security for people's belongings.

attributes.action: A public consultation with the people on the terms of leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
Since Britain voted to leave the EU we have heard from politicians, the media, and industry on their wants from future negotiations. 

A responsible Government should immediately begin a public consultation with the people to ensure their views are heard as part of any future negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The British People took power on whether we wanted to leave the EU in the June 2016 referendum, we have now become the silent voice in the debate over the terms of our departure. 

This petition is about ensuring that after having made the decision, the British people continue to be consulted on the type of future they want for their country.

attributes.action: Bring democracy to the workplace
attributes.background: Many of us today take great pride having democracy in politics, but one place we have never tried to implement democracy, the place we spend most of our adult life, is the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, I ask for this petition to include workers in each workplace to have the right to,

form a union

elect and deselect members of management

have a say on wages and hours

have a say on how the workplace is run and how the profits are used

allowed to have a weekly/monthly meeting to discuss and vote on anything the workers feel are necessary for the workplace

attributes.action: Have a cross party panel run the nhs rather than the government.
attributes.background: A cross party panel could make long term decisions for the nhs rather than the government making short term decisions based on their political ideology, popularity and what will keep the government in power.

attributes.action: People convicted of Drink driving should be disqualified for life.
attributes.background: Too many people previously convicted return to the road to commit the same offence putting other road users and pedestrians lives at risk.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Reverse the past 5 years of cuts to Social Care Budgets
attributes.background: The NHS is grinding to a halt often due to the lack of social care for patients awaiting discharge from hospital, and from the lack of community care obliging the elderly to attend A&E when they would be better helped at home.  The UK's Social care budget has been cut by 31% over the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Financial Statistics from the UK Directors of Adult Social Services budget survey 2015

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.
attributes.background: Most work places expect under 18 year olds to work for long amount of hours for hardly any money as the minimum wage is too low. Ensure a minimum of £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.

attributes.action: Make illegal the stopping of contact by a parent to a child before court
attributes.background:
I am starting this petition to try and make it illegal for one parent to stop another parent from spending time with their child when they have no grounds on which to do it. 
Myself and partner had regular contact with his daughter.This has been stopped for no reason & now we have to wait for court
attributes.additional_details: If parents separate they can arrange child contact between themselves. However, a parent can stop a child seeing the other parent, even if there has been consistent contact,without any justified reason,until an agreement is made through mediation or court.A court agreement can take many months. This results in a routine being changed & missed time with a parent. I believe if a routine has been in place & there is no reason to change this it should stay the same until the court decided otherwise.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.
